content.description: Start with your right hand on a small, sidepull crimp and your left hand on the positive ledge. Make a big dead point move to a SMALL crimp, and then match on a smaller crimp beside it. From there, get your left leg out from under the roof (which is 2 feet above the ground), and grab a fairly positive crimp with the left hand. Get your feet up, and top out using crimp rails and positive feet.
content.location:
This is located on the north side of the same boulder as

Grieving Process

. If you're looking at

Grieving Process

, it's to the left of it around the corner.

climbs.name: Grieving Process
climbs.fa: Mark Nickodemus (but feel free to PM me if you have info)

content.description: Sit start compressed with a good left hand and a TINY crimp far out with the right hand. Move up on one good foot hold to a solid hold, and top out.
content.location:
This is a little different than the parking for rest of Escondido. Drive past the normal parking area and turn right on Escondido. then take the first right into a cul-de-sac. I spoke with the owners of the home, and they were cool with people parking in the area, just be sure to walk around their yard so they stay cool.

Head northeast for about 4 minutes and you'll see a shorter, solid block. Grieving Process climbs the boulder's southwest arete.

content.description: Start on the right with a heel hook and a good hold. Move up and left arriving at a sloper. You can match this or just move up. Top out.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder as

Grieving Process

and

Tibia Delight

. This is on the east side of the boulder.
